name: Healthcare
samplePrompt:
Extract structured PHR elements from each selected encounter note. Output Markdown only:

For each encounter produce:
1) A table with columns: Patient (if present), Chief Complaint, HPI, Medications, Allergies, Vitals, Assessment, Plan, ICD‑10 candidates.
2) A short checklist of missing/uncertain fields.

Keep entries concise and de‑identified; do not invent data.

chunks.title: Encounter A – Primary Care (free‑form)
chunks.body:
Subjective: 34‑year‑old adult presents c/o seasonal allergies, itchy eyes, sneezing x2 wks. Denies fever, SOB, chest pain.
Meds: OTC loratadine PRN. No known drug allergies.
Vitals: BP 118/72, HR 76, Temp 98.6F, RR 14.
Assessment: Allergic rhinitis likely.
Plan: Start daily intranasal steroid; continue OTC non‑sedating antihistamine; saline rinses; f/u 2–4 wks if no improvement.

chunks.title: Encounter B – Telehealth (dialogue style)
chunks.body:
Clinician: Tell me about your cough.
Patient: Dry cough 10 days, worse at night. No fever. COVID home test negative.
Clinician: Using any meds?
Patient: Herbal tea only.
Clinician: Any history of asthma or reflux?
Patient: Mild reflux.
Impression: post‑viral cough vs reflux‑related cough.
Plan: trial PPI for 2 wks, nighttime humidifier, honey tea; return if dyspnea/fever or >4 wks.

chunks.title: Encounter C – ER Triage (bullet style)
chunks.body:
• CC: acute ankle pain after misstep; audible pop.
• Allergies: NKDA.
• Meds: ibuprofen PRN.
• Vitals: BP 126/80, HR 82, Temp 98.2F, SpO2 99%.
• Exam: swelling, tenderness lateral malleolus, limited ROM.
• Plan: RICE, X‑ray to r/o fracture, ankle brace, ortho f/u.

chunks.title: Encounter D – Dictation w/ artifacts
chunks.body: Uh patient, mid‑50s, came in for, um, blood pressure check. Home readings high in the morning. On lisinopril 10 mg. No chest pain. Headaches sometimes. Today's BP 148/92, repeat 142/90. Plan increase lisinopril to 20 mg, lifestyle counseling, log BPs, follow up 2–3 wks.

chunks.title: PHR Field Guide (sections)
chunks.body: Target fields to extract per encounter: Chief Complaint (reason for visit); HPI (brief timeline & key symptoms); Medications (name + dose if present); Allergies; Vitals; Assessment (working dx); Plan (orders, meds, f/u); ICD‑10 candidates (top 1–3). If patient identifiers appear, keep them de‑identified in the table.
